scenario: You want AI to help you write a better essay.
user_instruction: Be specific about the topic, length, and your current draft.
gold_prompt: Help me improve this essay about climate change. It needs to be 800 words, more persuasive, and have a stronger conclusion. Here's my draft: [paste draft]
common_mistakes: Not saying what needs to improve
hint: Show your work so the AI can actually help.

scenario: You need a creative story for class.
user_instruction: Add details about genre, length, and what makes it interesting.
gold_prompt: Write a 600-word sci-fi story about a teen who discovers they can pause time. Include a plot twist at the end and keep the tone exciting.
common_mistakes: Asking for 'a story' without any direction
Not asking for an interesting ending
hint: Describe what would make this story awesome.

scenario: You're planning a hangout with friends.
user_instruction: Include where, how many people, activities you like, and budget.
gold_prompt: Plan a fun Saturday for 5 friends downtown. We like escape rooms and trying new food. Budget is $30 per person. Give us a schedule with times.
common_mistakes: Being too vague about what you like
hint: More details = better plan.

scenario: You want snack recipes with what you have at home.
user_instruction: List your ingredients and say what kind of snack you want.
gold_prompt: Suggest 3 easy snack recipes using eggs, cheese, bread, and tomatoes. I want something I can make in under 15 minutes. No baking!
common_mistakes: Not saying how much time you have
hint: Tell the AI exactly what's in your kitchen.

scenario: You want to learn a new skill.
user_instruction: Be specific about the skill, your level, and how much time you have.
gold_prompt: Create a 30-day plan to learn basic guitar. I'm a complete beginner with an acoustic guitar. I can practice 20 minutes daily. Start with easy pop songs.
common_mistakes: Forgetting how much time you can spend
Not mentioning what type of guitar
hint: Your skill level matters a lot!

scenario: You need help preparing for a presentation.
user_instruction: Include the topic, length, and who your audience is.
gold_prompt: Help me prepare a 5-minute presentation about social media's effect on teens for my communications class. Give me an outline with talking points and a strong opening.
common_mistakes: Not saying how long it should be
hint: Who are you presenting to?

scenario: You want good podcast or music recommendations.
user_instruction: Share what you already like and what mood you're going for.
gold_prompt: Recommend 5 podcasts similar to 'Stuff You Should Know'. I like learning random facts and the hosts should be funny. Episodes should be under 45 minutes.
common_mistakes: Not naming what you already like
Not describing the vibe you want
hint: Give examples of what you already enjoy.

scenario: You want gift ideas for a friend.
user_instruction: Include their interests, your budget, and what NOT to get.
gold_prompt: Suggest 5 birthday gift ideas for my friend who loves K-pop and art. Budget is $40. No clothes or albums—they have too many. Explain why each is a good fit.
common_mistakes: Forgetting to say what they already have
hint: What are they really into?

scenario: You need a thank-you message for someone who helped you.
user_instruction: Say who helped you and what they did.
gold_prompt: Write a thank-you note to my neighbor who tutored me in math for free before my exam. Mention that I got a B+ and their patience really helped.
hint: Specific thanks feel more genuine.

scenario: You want to explain a game to a friend.
user_instruction: Name the game and describe their experience level.
gold_prompt: Explain how to play Valorant to someone who's never played any FPS games. Focus on the basics: movement, aiming, and what agents do. Keep it simple.
hint: Start with the absolute basics.

scenario: You're stuck on a homework problem.
user_instruction: Show your work and explain where you got stuck.
gold_prompt: I'm stuck on this physics problem about velocity. Here's what I tried: [show work]. I got confused at step 3. Can you explain what I did wrong?
hint: Show your work so AI can find the mistake.

scenario: You need a study schedule for exams.
user_instruction: List your subjects, exam dates, and available time.
gold_prompt: Create a study schedule for my 4 exams next week. Math (Monday), Bio (Tuesday), English (Thursday), History (Friday). I have 3 hours free each day after school.
common_mistakes: Not saying how much time you have
hint: Be exact about dates and time.

scenario: You want feedback on your art or design.
user_instruction: Share the work and ask about specific things.
gold_prompt: Here's my poster design for the school talent show [describe or share]. Is the text easy to read? Are the colors too busy? What should I change?
common_mistakes: Asking 'Is it good?' which is too vague
hint: Ask about specific things you're unsure about.

scenario: You want advice on a situation with friends.
user_instruction: Explain the full situation and what outcome you want.
gold_prompt: My two best friends are fighting and I'm stuck in the middle. [explain situation]. How do I stay friends with both without picking sides? I don't want drama.
common_mistakes: Being too vague about the problem
hint: What's the ideal outcome for you?

scenario: You want the perfect caption for a photo.
user_instruction: Describe the photo, the platform, and the vibe.
gold_prompt: Write 3 Instagram caption options for my sunset beach photo. Make one funny, one aesthetic/poetic, and one with song lyrics. Add relevant emojis!
hint: Give options so you can pick your favorite.

scenario: You want to understand something from a show or movie.
user_instruction: Name the show and the specific confusing part.
gold_prompt: Explain the ending of Inception without spoilers for other movies. I don't understand—was he still dreaming? Break it down simply.
common_mistakes: Asking about 'the movie' without naming it
Asking for spoilers you don't want
hint: Be specific about what confused you.

scenario: You need a workout plan with limitations.
user_instruction: Add your constraints: no equipment, injuries, time limit.
gold_prompt: Make a 4-week workout plan for building stamina. No gym equipment. I have a knee injury so no running or jumping. 25 minutes max per workout.
common_mistakes: Not saying what you have access to
hint: Safety first—mention any injuries!

scenario: You're making a playlist for a specific vibe.
user_instruction: Set rules: genre, no certain artists, length.
gold_prompt: Make a 2-hour study playlist. Chill lo-fi beats only, no lyrics, nothing too slow that'll make me sleepy. Include artist and song names.
common_mistakes: Asking for a playlist without a mood
Forgetting 'no lyrics' if you need focus
hint: Tell AI what to avoid.

scenario: You're planning a group project meeting.
user_instruction: Consider everyone's busy schedules and find a time.
gold_prompt: Find 3 possible times for our group project call. Alex is free Mon/Wed 4-7pm, Jordan is free Mon-Fri after 5pm, I'm free anytime except Tuesday. We need 1 hour.
hint: Give all the scheduling constraints.

scenario: You want laptop recommendations for school.
user_instruction: Set limits: budget, must-haves, deal-breakers.
gold_prompt: Recommend 3 laptops for a high school student under $700. Must have good battery life (8+ hours) and run Photoshop smoothly. No Chromebooks.
common_mistakes: Forgetting what you need it for
hint: Price and purpose are key rules.

scenario: You need to send a serious text but not sound mean.
user_instruction: Be direct but kind. No harsh language.
gold_prompt: Help me write a text telling my friend I can't always give them rides anymore because it's getting too expensive. Be honest but not hurtful.
hint: You can be honest without being mean.

scenario: You want to design something (poster, logo, etc.).
user_instruction: Set constraints: colors, style, where it'll be used.
gold_prompt: Describe a vintage-style concert poster for my friend's band. Colors: black, gold, and red only. Include a lightning bolt somewhere. It's for Instagram posts.
common_mistakes: Not saying the style you want
hint: Limits actually spark creativity!

scenario: You're planning a birthday party.
user_instruction: Balance what different people want.
gold_prompt: Plan my 16th birthday party for 15 friends. Half want to dance, half want to chill and talk. Find activities that work for both. Budget is $200 total.
hint: Find something everyone can enjoy.

scenario: You want to ask for a better grade on an assignment.
user_instruction: Stick to facts and examples, not feelings.
gold_prompt: Help me write an email to my teacher asking them to review my essay grade. Focus on specific feedback I addressed and where I think points were unfairly deducted. Be respectful.
hint: Point to actual evidence.

scenario: You need a packing list for a trip.
user_instruction: Ask for categories like clothes, toiletries, electronics.
gold_prompt: Make a packing checklist for a 5-day beach vacation. Organize by: Clothes, Toiletries, Beach Stuff, Electronics, and Important Documents. Add checkboxes.
common_mistakes: Just asking for a list without groups
Not saying the type of trip
hint: Categories make packing easier.

scenario: You want to start journaling.
user_instruction: Ask for a specific template with sections.
gold_prompt: Create a daily journal template with these sections: 1. Mood Check (emoji scale), 2. Today's Wins (3 things), 3. Tomorrow's Goal, 4. Random Thought.
common_mistakes: Asking for a generic journal entry
Forgetting how many items per section
hint: Structure makes journaling easier.

scenario: You want to compare options before deciding.
user_instruction: Ask for a table with specific categories.
gold_prompt: Compare Spotify, Apple Music, and YouTube Music in a table. Columns: Price, Free Tier, Sound Quality, Best Feature, Biggest Downside.
common_mistakes: Asking for paragraphs instead of a table
Letting the AI pick random categories
hint: Tables are perfect for comparing.

scenario: You want to create a character for a story or game.
user_instruction: Give a specific character sheet template.
gold_prompt:
Create an RPG character using this format:
**Name:**
**Class:**
**Backstory:** (3 sentences)
**Strengths:** (2)
**Weakness:** (1)
**Catchphrase:**
common_mistakes: Asking for 'a character' with no format
hint: Show exactly how it should look.

scenario: You need help organizing your week.
user_instruction: Ask for headers for each day and time blocks.
gold_prompt: Make me a weekly schedule template. Each day should have sections: Morning Routine, School/Homework, Free Time, and Evening Wind-Down. Include time estimates.
common_mistakes: Forgetting to customize for your routine
hint: Time blocks keep you on track.

scenario: You're giving instructions to someone watching your pet.
user_instruction: Ask for a numbered list in time order.
gold_prompt: Write pet care instructions for my dog for 3 days. Use a numbered list: Morning (feeding, walk), Afternoon (playtime), Evening (dinner, bathroom). Include amounts and times.
hint: Step-by-step is easier to follow.

scenario: You want to organize your movie watchlist.
user_instruction: Ask for a specific format with categories.
gold_prompt: Organize my movie watchlist into a table with: Title, Genre, Where to Watch (Netflix/Disney+/etc), Priority (High/Medium/Low), and Notes.
hint: A good format saves time later.

scenario: You're making a 'get to know me' post.
user_instruction: Ask for clear sections and a fun format.
gold_prompt: Help me make an 'About Me' template for my Tumblr with sections: Basics (name, age, pronouns), Favorites (3 movies, 3 songs), Currently (reading, watching, obsessed with), Fun Facts (3).
hint: Sections make profiles scannable.

scenario: The AI gave you wrong info about a book or movie.
user_instruction: Point out the mistake and ask it to double-check.
gold_prompt: You said Harry Potter has 8 books, but there are only 7 in the main series. Can you correct that and list all the actual book titles?
hint: Be specific about what's incorrect.

scenario: The math solution looks wrong.
user_instruction: Ask the AI to show step-by-step work.
gold_prompt: Solve (3x + 6) / 3 = 9. Show me every step of how you got the answer so I can check your work.
hint: Steps reveal mistakes.

scenario: The AI made up a quote or fact.
user_instruction: Ask for the source or admit if it's uncertain.
gold_prompt: You quoted Einstein saying that. Can you tell me where that quote is from? If you're not sure it's a real quote, please say so.
hint: Ask where the info came from.

scenario: The poem or lyrics AI wrote don't follow the rules.
user_instruction: Ask it to count and verify.
gold_prompt: Write a limerick about pizza. Remember: the rhyme scheme is AABBA and line 3 and 4 are shorter. Show the rhyme pattern next to each line.
common_mistakes: Not asking AI to verify itself
hint: Make the AI prove it followed the rules.

scenario: You're splitting costs with friends unevenly.
user_instruction: Explain the exact split you want.
gold_prompt: We're splitting a $75 dinner bill, but I only had appetizers ($15). Calculate how much I should pay vs. the other 2 friends who shared the rest equally.
hint: Fair doesn't always mean equal.

scenario: The AI's description or essay is too boring.
user_instruction: Tell it what specific details to add.
gold_prompt: This book summary is too generic. Rewrite it to mention: the main character's motivation, the central conflict, and a surprising plot point. Make it hook the reader.
hint: Tell it exactly what to add.

scenario: The AI forgot about time zones.
broken_prompt: What time is it in Tokyo?
user_instruction: Give the time zone info clearly.
gold_prompt: My friend in Tokyo (JST, +9) wants to watch a movie with me in New York (EST, -5) at 8pm my time. What time is that for them?
hint: Always specify time zones.

scenario: The username suggestions are taken.
user_instruction: Ask for backup options with variations.
gold_prompt: I want the username 'NightOwl' but it's taken everywhere. Give me 10 creative variations using underscores, numbers, or related words that still feel like me.
common_mistakes: Not planning for it to be taken
hint: Always have backup options.

scenario: The list got sorted wrong.
user_instruction: Explain exactly how you want it sorted.
gold_prompt: Sort my movie list by rating (highest first), then by year (newest first) if ratings are equal. Here's the list: [paste list]
common_mistakes: Not saying what to do with ties
hint: Be specific about the sort order.

scenario: The AI gave advice without knowing the full situation.
user_instruction: Add the missing context.
gold_prompt: You suggested I talk to my friend, but we haven't spoken in 2 months since the argument. Given that context, what's a good first message to break the ice?
hint: Context changes everything.

scenario: You need facts for a school report.
user_instruction: Ask the AI to verify key facts.
gold_prompt: Write 5 facts about space exploration for my report. For each fact, rate your confidence (high/medium/low) so I know which ones to double-check myself.
hint: Even AI can be wrong—verify important stuff.

scenario: You want predictions or guesses about something.
user_instruction: Ask for probabilities, not certainty.
gold_prompt: Based on their current stats, which team is more likely to win the championship? Give me odds and explain what could change the outcome.
common_mistakes: Expecting AI to predict the future
hint: Ask for likelihood, not certainty.

scenario: You want the AI to critique its own work.
user_instruction: Ask it to grade itself and suggest improvements.
gold_prompt: Write me a short bio for my college application. Then score it 1-10 for: uniqueness, clarity, and personality. Suggest one thing to make it stronger.
hint: Make AI be its own editor.

scenario: You're researching something with multiple viewpoints.
user_instruction: Ask for both sides of the argument.
gold_prompt: Explain the debate around social media and mental health. Give 3 points from each side (good and bad effects) so I can form my own opinion.
common_mistakes: Letting AI pick a side for you
hint: Get all perspectives before deciding.

scenario: You need a cost estimate for something.
user_instruction: Ask for a range and what assumptions were made.
gold_prompt: Estimate the cost of building a gaming PC. Give me a Low, Medium, and High budget option. Tell me what parts you're assuming for each.
hint: Estimates should be ranges, not absolutes.

scenario: The AI wrote code for you.
user_instruction: Ask it to explain the code and check for issues.
gold_prompt: Here's the Python function you wrote me. Walk me through what each line does and flag any parts that might break with different inputs.
hint: Always understand code before using it.

scenario: You're asking about rules or policies (school, sports, etc.).
user_instruction: Ask the AI to remind you to verify with official sources.
gold_prompt: What are the NCAA eligibility rules for student athletes? At the end, remind me to check the official NCAA website since rules can change.
hint: Always verify official rules yourself.

scenario: You're explaining something to a specific audience.
user_instruction: Ask AI to check if the language is appropriate.
gold_prompt: Explain cryptocurrency to a 12-year-old. After writing it, check: Did you use any words a typical 12-year-old wouldn't know? If so, simplify them.
common_mistakes: Not asking for a language check
hint: Match your words to your audience.

scenario: You want to make sure your message lands well.
user_instruction: Ask AI to analyze the tone and suggest fixes.
gold_prompt: Here's the DM I'm sending to ask someone to a school dance. Read it and tell me: Does it sound confident or desperate? Does it give them an easy way to say no? How can I improve it?
common_mistakes: Being unaware of how you sound
hint: How you say it matters as much as what you say.

scenario: You want to quote lyrics or a famous line.
user_instruction: Ask AI to verify it's accurate.
gold_prompt: Quote the opening lines of 'Bohemian Rhapsody'. Make sure every word is exactly right—I'm putting this on my wall.
hint: Quotes need to be word-perfect.
